AudioDecoder.summary: The AudioDecoder interface of the decodes chunks of audio.

AudioDecoderIsConfigSupported.summary: The isConfigSupported() static method of the interface checks if the given config is supported (that is, if objects can be successfully configured with the given config).
AudioDecoderIsConfigSupported.returns: A that resolves with an object containing the following members:

AudioDecoderDecodeQueueSize.summary: The decodeQueueSize read-only property of the interface returns the number of pending decode requests in the queue.
AudioDecoderDecodeQueueSize.value: An integer containing the number of requests.

AudioDecoderFlush.summary: The flush() method of the interface returns a Promise that resolves once all pending messages in the queue have been completed.

AudioDecoderConfigure.summary: The configure() method of the interface enqueues a control message to configure the audio decoder for decoding chunks.

AudioDecoderState.summary: The state read-only property of the interface returns the current state of the underlying codec.
AudioDecoderState.value: A string containing one of the following values:

AudioDecoderDequeue.summary: The dequeue event of the interface fires to signal a decrease in .

remarks.para: This eliminates the need for developers to use a poll to determine when the queue has decreased, and more work should be queued up.

AudioDecoderDecode.summary: The decode() method of the interface enqueues a control message to decode a given chunk of audio.

AudioDecoderClose.summary: The close() method of the interface ends all pending work and releases system resources.

AudioDecoderReset.summary: The reset() method of the interface resets all states including configuration, control messages in the control message queue, and all pending callbacks.

AudioDecoderAudioDecoder.summary: The AudioDecoder() constructor creates a new object with the provided init.output callback assigned as the output callback, the provided init.error callback as the error callback, and the set to "unconfigured".
